allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
fix: Generate demo comps near actual property location

**Problem:**
Demo comparables were always generated in Orlando downtown, even when 
property was in different cities (e.g., Eatonville 5 miles away).
This caused map pins to appear far from the subject property.

**Solution:**
- Updated generateFallbackComps to accept subject property coordinates
- Generate random addresses within 1 mile radius of actual property
- Use property lat/lng if available, fallback to Orlando center
- Each comp gets random offset of Â±0.028 degrees (~1 mile)

**Technical Changes:**
- generateFallbackComps signature: added subjectAddress, subjectLat, subjectLng params
- Dynamic address generation using random street names + numbers
- Coordinates calculated relative to subject property position
- All 3 fallback calls now pass property coordinates

**Result:**
Map now correctly shows all comps clustered near the selected property,
regardless of city. Comps in Eatonville appear in Eatonville, not Orlando.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
fix: Use subject property ZIP code for demo comps

**Problem:**
Demo comparables were using hardcoded ZIP 32801 (Orlando downtown)
regardless of where the subject property was located.

**Solution:**
- Extract ZIP code from subject property address using regex
- Use extracted ZIP for all generated demo comps
- Fallback to 32801 if ZIP not found
- Added debug logging to show coordinates and ZIP being used

**Technical Changes:**
- Added ZIP extraction: `subjectAddress?.match(/\b\d{5}\b/)`
- Updated demo comp generation to use `subjectZip` instead of hardcoded value
- Added console log showing lat/lng/ZIP for debugging

**Result:**
Demo comps now appear in correct ZIP code area matching subject property.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
